questions.guidance_text: Select 'New Policy' if this is your first Erection All Risk insurance or you're switching insurers. Select 'Renewal' if continuing an existing policy for an ongoing project.
Enter the legal name of the company undertaking the erection/installation project. This should match your registration documents and will be the primary policyholder.
Provide the complete address where all policy documents and correspondence should be sent. Include building details, street, area, city, state, and PIN code.
questions.placeholder: e.g., Tower A, Tech Park, Sector 62, Noida, Uttar Pradesh - 201309

questions.guidance_text: Enter your 15-character GST registration number for tax compliance. This will be used for premium invoicing and GST credits on your insurance expenses.
Provide the name of the project manager or authorized person who will coordinate insurance matters. This person should have complete knowledge of the project details.
Enter a 10-digit mobile number for urgent communications about the policy or claims. This number will receive SMS updates on policy status.
Provide an official email address for receiving policy documents, endorsements, and claim forms. Ensure this email is regularly monitored.
Enter a clear project name or brief description that identifies what is being erected or installed. This helps insurers understand the nature and complexity of the work.
questions.placeholder: e.g., Installation of 5MW Solar Power Plant at Rajasthan

questions.guidance_text: Select the actual date when physical work at the site began or will begin. This includes site preparation, foundation work, or equipment delivery to site.
Enter the anticipated project completion date including testing and commissioning. The policy period should cover this entire duration plus any buffer for delays.
Select when insurance coverage should begin. This is typically the date when valuable materials arrive at site or work commences, whichever is earlier.
Select coverage end date, usually project completion plus testing period. Add buffer time for potential delays. Extensions can be requested if project extends.
Select the category that best describes your erection/installation project. This helps insurers assess technical risks and apply appropriate terms and rates.
Enter the total expected project duration in months from start to final handover. Include time for procurement, installation, testing, and commissioning phases.
If this is mid-term insurance or renewal, indicate what percentage of the project is already complete. For new projects, enter 0. This affects risk assessment and premium.
Provide the complete site address where erection/installation is taking place. Include landmark details for remote locations. Multiple sites should be listed separately.
questions.placeholder: e.g., Plot No. 45, MIDC Industrial Area, Pune-Nashik Highway, Chakan, Pune, Maharashtra - 410501

questions.guidance_text: Mention the nearest major transport hub to the project site. This information helps assess accessibility for equipment transport and emergency response.
questions.placeholder: e.g., Pune Airport (35 km), Pune Railway Station (40 km)

questions.guidance_text: Enter the total project value including equipment cost, erection charges, customs duty, and transport. This should represent the full replacement cost at current prices, not depreciated values.
Provide component-wise breakdown: Equipment/Machinery value, Erection costs, Civil works, Freight/Customs, and other costs. This ensures adequate coverage for each project element.
questions.placeholder: e.g., Equipment: ₹20 Cr, Erection: ₹3 Cr, Civil Work: ₹1.5 Cr, Transport: ₹50 Lakhs

questions.guidance_text: Enter the name of the project owner or principal for whom the work is being done. They are often co-insured in the policy to protect their interests.
Describe the main equipment/machinery being installed with specifications like capacity, make, model. Include whether equipment is new or refurbished. Technical details help accurate risk assessment.
questions.placeholder: e.g., 2 x Gas Turbines (GE 9FA, 250MW each), 1 x Steam Turbine (Siemens SST-5000, 200MW), Heat Recovery Steam Generators

questions.guidance_text: Enter the number of days needed for testing and commissioning after installation. This high-risk period when equipment is first operated needs special coverage consideration.
Describe similar projects completed in the last 5 years including project value and any challenges faced. Experience in similar projects indicates lower risk and can reduce premiums.
questions.placeholder: e.g., Installed 3 solar plants (10MW, 15MW, 20MW) in Rajasthan during 2022-2024, all completed successfully without major incidents

questions.guidance_text: Select all conditions that apply to your project site. Environmental and geographical factors significantly impact risk levels and influence coverage terms and premiums.
Select all safety measures implemented at the project site. Strong safety protocols reduce accident probability and demonstrate risk management, potentially lowering premiums.
Indicate how equipment and materials are stored before installation. Proper storage reduces damage risk from weather, theft, or mishandling during the project period.
Indicate if any portion of work is subcontracted. Multiple contractors increase coordination risks but specialized subcontractors may reduce technical risks.
List major subcontractors with their scope of work and experience. Include whether they have their own insurance. This helps assess overall project risk profile.
questions.placeholder: e.g., ABC Electricals - Electrical work, 10 years experience; XYZ Civil - Foundation work, insured separately

questions.guidance_text: Covers legal liability for bodily injury or property damage to third parties during erection work. Essential as construction sites pose risks to visitors, neighbors, and passersby.

Select the maximum amount payable for third party claims per incident and in aggregate. Higher limits recommended for projects in populated areas or near existing facilities. You can enter the amount in lakhs or crores (e.g., 50,00,000 or 5,00,00,000).
Covers damage to existing property belonging to principal or located nearby. Important when working in operational plants or near existing structures that could be damaged.
Enter the value of existing property that could be damaged during erection work. Assess realistically based on proximity and nature of work being done.
Extends coverage during the defect liability period after project handover. Covers damage during maintenance visits and defects discovered during this period.
Enter the maintenance/defect liability period in months as per contract. Standard periods are 12-24 months. Longer periods may be required for complex projects.
Covers costs of removing debris after an insured loss. Important as cleanup costs can be substantial, especially for large equipment or in environmentally sensitive areas.
Covers additional costs for expedited shipping of replacement parts after a loss. Critical for time-sensitive projects where delays result in penalties or revenue loss.
Covers increase in project costs due to inflation during long-duration projects. Recommended for projects exceeding 12 months to ensure sum insured remains adequate.
Extends coverage to include losses from terrorist activities. Consider based on project location and sensitivity. Adds marginal premium but provides comprehensive protection.

Select your preferred deductible (amount you bear per claim). Higher deductibles reduce premium but increase your out-of-pocket expense during claims. Balance based on risk appetite. You can enter the amount in lakhs or crores (e.g., 50,00,000 or 5,00,00,000).
Declare if you've had any erection/construction insurance claims in the past 5 years. Transparency ensures proper coverage and avoids disputes during claims.
Provide details of past claims including date, cause of loss, claim amount, and settlement status. This helps insurers assess risk and may not necessarily increase premium.
questions.placeholder: e.g., June 2023 - Equipment damage during unloading, ₹15 lakhs claimed, settled

questions.guidance_text: Upload the main project contract or work order. This helps understand project scope, timelines, and contractual obligations that need insurance coverage.
Upload detailed equipment list or Bill of Quantities with values. This ensures all project components are adequately covered and helps in faster claim settlement.
Upload site layout showing equipment placement, storage areas, and neighboring properties. Visual representation helps insurers better understand risk exposures.
Mention any special coverage requirements, unique project features, or specific concerns not covered above. This ensures customized coverage for your project needs.
questions.placeholder: e.g., Project involves specialized imported equipment, require coverage for delayed startup losses

questions.guidance_text: By checking this box, you confirm all information provided is accurate and complete. Misrepresentation can lead to claim rejection or policy voidance.
questions.placeholder: I declare that the information provided is accurate
